title: Why does water form by hydrogen and oxygen? - Quora

response.answer_text: I shall also begin with a question. If you apply algebraic formula how many permutations combinations are possible? If you are a snience college student you will be able to tell. My mathematics is weak. H2 is +1 valency and O2 is -2 valency. Both are highly reactive and have great chemical affinity towards each other. So when they come together and get a spark, H2O is formed and nothing else can be formed. Not HO, not OH, not even O2H. And in common language, H2O is called water.

Water is not formed by hydrogen and oxygen, it is the other way, that is hydrogen and oxygen combine to form a molecule which is commonly known as water and in science known as H2O. If we take 2 atoms of hydrogen and 1 atom of oxygen, then they combine by hydrogen bond and form a molecule which we commonly know as water.
